etymologies: late 19th century (in an earlier sense). From allo- + -plasty

definitions: Surgical repair or replacement of tissue and organs with inorganic or synthetic materials, or (especially in early use) with animal tissue; an instance of this.
Alteration of the external environment to meet the needs of the individual; alloplastic adaptation.

notes.text: Opposed to autoplasty, adaptation of the individual to suit the environment.
